featured.text: The laborers mostly wore dark and dirty uniforms.
They came from northwest England, the blackened heart of the Industrial Revolution: Its main street was “a dark, unattractive hole” and the river running through it was a string of dirty water.

definition.zh_def: 不乾淨的，有污垢或髒物的。
definition.en_def: Not clean; covered or marked with an unclean substance.
definition.example: The dog rolled in the mud and got dirty.
